page.title: 02KETTLEWELL, NORTH YORKSHIRE
page.content: Kettlewell's buildings are of local stones, to blend naturally with the surrounding scenery. seventy-five houses are permanently occupied, forty-seven are unoccupied for long periods, being mainly holiday cottages. There are no derelict buildings. Several structures are graded as listed buildings, including the main bridge over the Wharfe, being rebuilt to the original design this year after a partial collapse in February. A Bailey Bridge and the only traffic-lights in the whole dale have been temporarily installed to control single flow traffic, which can be heavy at certain times. The village has a church, primary school, village hall and a small Methodist chapel, which has closed this year because of high expense and a dwindling congregation.
